tool.name: seqtk_sample
tool.description: random subsample of fasta or fastq sequences

param.label: RNG seed
param.help: The seed used for the random number generator. Manually specifying a number here is useful for reproducing the same subsampling in different runs (e.g. read 1 and read 2)

param.name: subsample_size
param.label: Subsample (decimal fraction or number)
param.help: Use an integer > 1 to select a specific number of reads. Use a decimal (e.g. 0.5) to select a fraction of reads

param.name: single_pass_mode
param.label: Enable 1-pass mode
param.help: Use this if the number of reads you want to sample is small enough to fit into memory. If you're not sure, don't use this.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Takes a random subsample of FASTA or FASTQ sequences. The RNG is seedable to allow for reproducible results, and defaults to `4 <http://xkcd.com/221/>`__.
The subsample size can be a decimal fraction <=1, where 1 implies 100% of the reads should be used. If a number >1 is provided, that many reads will be taken from the dataset.
Two pass sampling mode reads the input file once to build a list of reads to output then again to output the reads. It is twice as slow, but uses much less RAM. It is only in effect when an integer number of reads (not a fraction) is specified as subsample size.
@ATTRIBUTION@
